main event: A large, luminous, metallic, bell-shaped object descended into a field on a farmer's property in Gills Rock, Wisconsin on September 6, 1959.
interesting points: The object appeared to be damaged or distorted and was approximately 30 feet in diameter.
When the reporting officer (Lt. Mac Laughlin) attempted to approach the object, he was driven back by an intense heat and glare emanating from it.
After several minutes, the object suddenly rose straight up and accelerated rapidly out of sight.
No other witnesses were present at the time of the incident.
A thorough search of the area revealed no evidence or clues as to the origin or nature of the object.
witnesses: Lt. Mac Laughlin, a farmer named Mr. Sam Gills
photographs: yes, the report includes a black and white photograph of the damaged or distorted object
